page.title: 11RELIGION IN CURY/GUNWALLOE
page.content: The vicar gives church services in Mawgan, Cury and Gunwalloe.The length of the services varies.The shortest is about 15 minutes and the longest is usually an hour long. The earliest service he holds starts at 8.30am on a Thursday morning.He has two jobs as vicar.The first is to hold services in the six churches in his parish. The second is to help everyone in the Cury/Gunwalloe area. The churches have choirs and Sunday Schools. They also hold Jumble Sales,Bazzars,etc.The churches in the area are situated in Cury Village and Gunwalloe Church Cove.The former being dedicated to St.Corantyn in 1261 and the latter built in the fourteenth century. There was a Methodist Chapel in Berepper but it closed owing to lack of support.There are a small number of Jews & Moslems in the area.
